channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping, 25th June
item.description:
Local business is throwing out their old machines, renovation materials and bedding. Been there for a week now with more items added daily. Not deterred by CCTV.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Standard Place, Hackney, London

item.title: The traffic signals at the junction of KILBURN HIGH ROAD - QUEX ROAD - VICTORIA ROAD, 25th June
item.description:
Our engineer has attended damaged signals resulting from an RTA. He reported that around pole 2 footpath has lifted and metal bell all lifted. This needs to be attended to by Camden council to repair have left barrier around lifted path but would advise local borough to get barriers out ASAP to barrier off damaged footpath
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kilburn High Road, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree exstreamly big and causing major issues and problems with ours and other’s property., 25th June
item.description:
Iv reported this tree 4 times and nothing is being done. It’s extremely dangerous and it’s bringing up the path it’s also very very nearly touching our windows. It’s distroying our home balcony and new windows. Several of us have put complaints in last year but nothings been done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saxon Walk, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside ESS Algernon Road, 25th June
item.description:
After making the report this morning two things happened. 1 Without visiting the site someone from Brent did this: Allocated to Crew State changed to: In progress Posted by Brent Council at 08:27 today Council issue BHM State changed to: No further action Posted by Brent Council at 08:29 today So within a two minute interval it was decided not to bother clearing up this MONTH OLD MESS. Didn’t stop someone later sweeping the rubbish on the pavement while leaving most of it untouched. This just encourages others to dump - as the second photo posted here demonstrates- and vermin to forage. Please clear it up.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Algernon Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Person / people feeding foxes - lots of foxes, 25th June
item.description:
A person has been caught on camera feeding foxes. We now have a fox problem in the area. There are lots of them coming into our garden in day light, relatively tame, digging up gardens, food scraps being left in gardens and on the street. It’s got so bad neighbours are discussing on WhatsApp what to do. Please can you help.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Egerton Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rear of 6 wateringbury close shrubs need trimming and tree pruned to low level and debris needs to be removed because public keep dumping rubbish and people loitering under tree smoking, 25th June
item.description:

item.title: Dead Tree - Danger, 25th June
item.description:
